basics.name: Yonatan G. Achamyeleh
basics.label: Ph.D. Candidate - Computer Engineering
basics.summary: Ph.D. candidate in Computer Engineering at University of California, Irvine with a focus on Embedded and Cyber-Physical Systems Security, Machine Learning for Binary Analysis, and Binary Instrumentation.

work.name: Autonomous and Intelligent Cyber-Physical Systems Lab - UCI
highlights: Developed AGNOMIN, an advanced architecture-agnostic framework for binary analysis, integrating hierarchical Graph Neural Networks with attention mechanisms and domain-specific tokenization to enable robust cross-architectural function identification and similarity detection.

Engineered BaroVox, an innovative acoustic side-channel framework combining advanced signal processing with custom neural architectures (ResNet, denoising autoencoders) for speech reconstruction from sensor data, demonstrating new attack vectors in cyber-physical systems.

Developed novel acoustic-based attack vectors in cyber-physical systems, combining resonance analysis with signal processing techniques to demonstrate critical vulnerabilities in biosafety infrastructure and drones.
Optimized binary instrumentation and analysis techniques through LLVM compiler framework, enhancing memory sanitizers and fuzzing processes for improved system security.

Contributed to HyperDetect, a novel brain-inspired hyperdimensional computing solution for network security, implementing real-time intrusion detection through neural adaptation and dynamic encoding techniques for resource-constrained IoT environments.

work.name: Intel Corporation
highlights: Developed a novel approach to retrofit compiler-based memory safety into legacy binaries without source code, enhancing security in critical infrastructure.
Leveraged post-link binary optimization within the LLVM framework to balance performance impacts with improved security, reducing code size overhead.

Achieved a 100% detection rate for heap-related vulnerabilities in the Juliet test suite and demonstrated superior code-size efficiency on the SPEC benchmark compared to standard compiler instrumentation.
Gained insights into memory safety challenges specific to GPU architectures, broadening expertise in security across diverse computing environments.

work.name: Intel Corporation
highlights: Contributed to the DARPA-funded HARDEN program, focusing on securing Department of Defense systems by reinforcing toolchains against emergent execution engines (EEs).
Designed and implemented advanced binary instrumentation techniques to enhance security for both legacy and modern binaries, achieving strong protection without source code access.
Delivered a robust framework for assessing the program’s security objectives, ensuring project milestones were met on time, with achievements recognized by Intel Labs management.

work.name: Siemens Technology
work.position: Ph.D. Intern - Machine Learning-Based Micro Patch Generation
highlights: Contributed to DARPA-funded research on automated vulnerability patch generation for critical systems.
Developed graph-based deep learning approaches for binary characterization and patch synthesis, integrating hierarchical graph neural networks with attention mechanisms.
Improved cross-architectural binary analysis through novel embedding techniques, enabling robust vulnerability identification across different CPU architectures.

work.name: Lablup Inc.
highlights: Worked on 'Jail,' a ptrace-based program enabling system calls and file-system functions for Docker, used as a dynamic sandbox in Backend.Ai kernels.

work.name: KAIST Cyber Security Research Center (CSRC)
highlights: Developed a framework supporting native emulation for large-scale blockchain networks, enabling reproducible security and performance evaluations.
Enhanced native blockchain support for C/C++ and Golang, optimizing emulator compatibility.

volunteer.position: Conference PC Member to the Artifacts Evaluation Committee
Student Representative for the Engineering Department
volunteer.summary: Diverse Educational Community and Doctoral Experience (DECADE) provides students with professional development events, leadership opportunities, and a mutually empowering community.
highlights: Serve in an advisory role to DECADE leadership, faculty mentors, equity advisors, and the Graduate Dean’s Diversity Council.
Help plan and organize DECADE programming and events, fostering an equitable and warm climate for all UCI graduate students.

volunteer.organization: IEEE Transactions on Information Forensics & Security
highlights: Reviewed journal papers for IEEE Transactions on Information Forensics & Security.

volunteer.position: Conference PC Member to the Artifacts Evaluation Committee
highlights: Conference PC Member to the Artifacts Evaluation Committee.

volunteer.summary: Co-organized the inaugural UCI GEECS Annual Technology Showcase.
Assist and guide undergraduate and MS students in their research activities within our lab.
highlights: Assisted two undergraduate students on their Honors Thesis.

volunteer.organization: UCI School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
volunteer.summary: Advised students from underrepresented groups in engineering to answer any questions they may have before deciding about graduate school.

awards.title: UCI ECPS Fellowship 2024
awards.summary: Covers tuition, fees, health insurance and stipend equivalent to a 50% TA compensation. Given for students who have made contributions in the areas of Embedded and/or Cyber-Physical Systems.

awards.summary: Includes flights, accommodations, and conference registration. ($2000)

awards.title: ACSAC 2022 Conferenceship Award
awards.summary: Includes flights, accommodations, and conference registration. ($1600)

awards.title: ICML Black in AI Social Travel Grant
awards.summary: Includes flights, accommodations, and conference registration.

awards.title: Graduate Dean's Recruitment Fellowship
awards.summary: Designed to supplement financial support packages of prospective doctoral students who have received competitive offers from equivalent institutions. ($5000)

awards.title: JunctionX Seoul Hackathon – SI Analytic Track Winner (1st place)
awards.summary: Our group stood 1st place in the “Satellite Image Analysis by SIA Analytics” Track by developing Machine Learning based Sustainability Monitoring Service called SUMO.

awards.title: Yunho Hwang Scholarship

awards.title: Ethiopia Youth Scholarship 2017
awards.summary: Given to gifted Ethiopian students who are expected to not only contribute significantly to the development of Ethiopia but also promote friendly relationships between the Republic of Korea and Ethiopia. ($4800)

awards.title: Top 30 Score in the Ethiopian University Entrance Examination
awards.summary: Scored one of the top 30 scores among 350,000 test-takers. ($2000)
